channel.title: ECOT Computers
channel.description: Anyone have ANY clue at all how to by-pass the SEP blocking? I've tried several different things. I have access to pretty much nothing.. if that makes any difference at all. I've tried making a cp.bat with notepad and getting CP to Ping a websites IP, tried entering the IP into the address bar. Still does nothing.

item.title: ECOT Computers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Can you get an ssh client on there? (putty perhaps, what OS does it run, or is ECOT an OS?)

Read full topic

item.title: ECOT Computers
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

According to yahoo answers

The ECOT computer has programming that does not allow you to explore the web. That is one of the things about ECOT - sites are limited. ECOT does remote formatting of the computers to update software and fix problems. Any time you shut off the computer, it will revert back to saved programs.

If you want to explore the internet, go to the library or find a different computer. If ECOT detects that you have changed the computer, they can ask you to return it. You are tampering with school property.

You could try sticking in an Ubuntu live CD, if you’re lucky, they won’t have a BIOS password/set CD to first boot device.

Read full topic
